@charset "utf-8"; @import "../bower_components/bootstrap-sass/assets/stylesheets/_bootstrap"; @import "../_sass/mixins"; @import "../_sass/base"; @import "../_sass/syntax-highlighting"; // Import partials from `sass_dir` (defaults to `_sass`) $primary-yello: #F4B350; .jumbotron{ background: $primary-yello; } .featured-content { h3 { a { color: $primary-yello; &:hover{ color: #D35400; } } } p { color: #D35400; } } .pagination { > .active { > a { background: $primary-yello; } } }

About

Goal

The goal of this project is to setup a basic jekyll project scaffold that can be cloned from github that has bootstrap loaded and some sane scss defaults. The idea is to give some structure and code examples for getting a jekyll project off the ground while still promoting and encouraging flexibility in modifying the layout.

How to Use

  1. Clone the repository
  2. npm install will install the dependencies and cli-tools
  3. gulp dev will run the watcher: the sass-compiler and static site generator
### Sample static page generated from a `.md` file With jekyll, it's possible to generate static pages quickly and easily using either markdown or html. This allows for convenient updates to content for a site and easy configuration if you need to add content quickly. #### You can reference images like so: ![city image](/images/example-photo-2.jpg) ###### or by reference ![cool guy photo][cool-guy-lnk] ----- ### Using Links [Author's Github Account](https://github.com/t3patterson) [Cool House Music][cpp] [cool-guy-lnk]: /images/example-photo-1.jpg [2-](https://soundcloud.com/openairtogo/podcast32-christoph_woerner?in=krykitty/sets/christopher-woerner)

Links And Resources
